level.heading: Definitions.
level.text: For the purposes of this part, the term "Youth" means an individual under 21 years of age who is in the care of the Agency.

level.heading: History
level.text: (Sept. 23, 1977, D.C. Law 2-22, title III-C, ยง 371, as added Apr. 23, 2013, D.C. Law 19-276, ยง 2, 60 DCR 2060.)

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-276 added this section.

level.heading: Emergency Legislation
level.text: For temporary addition of this part, see ยง 2 of the Foster Youth Statements of Rights and Responsibilities Emergency Amendment Act of 2012 (D.C. Act 19-622, January 22, 2013, 60 DCR 1338).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 19-276
level.text: Law 19-276, the ""Foster Youth Statements of Rights and Responsibilities Amendment Act of 2012," was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 19-803. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on Dec. 4, 2012 and Dec. 18, 2012, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on Jan. 23, 2013, it was assigned Act No. 19-640 and transmitted to Congress for its review. D.C. Law 19-276 became effective on April 23, 2013.
